item.title: How to reset master to origin/master
Reset mysql root password
item.description: Stop mysql server: sudo systemctl stop mysql Create a /var/run/mysqld directory sudo mkdir -p /var/run/mysqld sudo chown mysql:mysql /var/run/mysqld Start mysql server in the safe mode: sudo mysqld_safe --skip-grant-tables & Run mysql client as root without password: mysql -u root Execute command: mysql> UPDATE mysql.user SET authentication_string = PASSWORD('new_password') WHERE User = 'root' AND Host = 'localhost'; Exit the mysql client: mysql> exit Terminate current mysqld process: sudo pkill mysqld Start mysqld in normal mode:

item.title: Mysql plugin for Qt under Ubuntu
item.description: Change directory with plugins source code cd /opt/Qt/5.12.8/Src/qtbase/src/plugins/sqldrivers Run qmake with path to mysql headers qmake -- MYSQL_PREFIX=/usr Run make to build mysql plugin sudo make sub-mysql Move to the directory where plugin will be located cd /opt/Qt/5.12.8/gcc_64/plugins/sqldrivers Copy plugin to that directory cp /opt/Qt/5.12.8/Src/qtbase/src/plugins/sqldrivers/plugins/sqldrivers/libqsqlmysql.so .

item.title: How to add custom qt version to qtchooser in Ubuntu
item.description: Create new folder if it doesnâ€™t exist: mkdir ~/.config/qtchooser Change directory: cd ~/.config/qtchooser Create new file: qt_version.conf Add to the created file following lines: /path/to/qt/bin /path/to/qt/lib Create symbolic link to the created file: ln -s qt_version.conf default.conf
